snippet: For the first time, State Senator Adriano Espaillat, the runner-up in last Tuesday’s election, questioned the results of the vote.
abstract: New York State Sen Adriano Espaillat publicly questions Rep Charles B Rangel's victory in Democratic primary in which he sought nomination for 22nd term in Congress; Espaillat says he will pursue issue in court, but political consultants express doubt that Rangel's victory in 13th Congressional District primary will be overturned.

byline.contributor: Kia Gregory, Michael M. Grynbaum and Vivian Yee contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: For the first time, State Senator Adriano Espaillat, the runner-up in last Tuesday’s election, questioned the results of the vote.

headline.seo: Rangel’s Primary Victory Clouded by Slow Count and Espaillat’s Questions
headline.main: Slow Count and Rival’s Doubts Cloud Rangel’s Primary Victory
headline.print_headline: Slow Count and Rival’s Doubts Cloud Rangel’s Primary Victory
